intro: Randia hondensis, commonly known as Honduran randia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Randia hondensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
